lead_paragraph: SAITO--Kikuo, a major color-field painter also known for his poetic theater works that incorporated costumes, light, music, and dance, died on February 15 at age 76. Kikuo was born in Tokyo in 1939, and moved to New York City in 1966, where he attended the Art Students League, an institution at which he later taught. His work, currently represented by Leslie Feely, is in the permanent collections of the MoMA and Whitney, among myriad other museums worldwide. Kikuo was married to Eva Maier until her death in 1997, and is survived by his second wife, Mikiko Ino, and the many students whom he chose to be his children. A viewing will be held this Friday, February 19, at the Greenwich Village Funeral Home, 199 Bleecker St., from 2-5pm and 7-9pm. 1/3
